film_condensed: Turing in police interview room.
reality_condensed: Turing was interviewed by police.

film_condensed: Police explore his smashed-up flat.
reality_condensed: Turing was burgled.

film_condensed: Menzies hears news of a crime against Turing.
reality_condensed: We don't know if MI6 monitored Turing.

film_condensed: Nock investigates the crime scene.
reality_condensed: Nock didn't exist.

film_condensed: Nock questions Turing.
reality_condensed: The police did interview Turing.

film_condensed: Nock and constable discuss Turing.
reality_condensed: It's likely.

film_condensed: Turing walks through child evacuation scene.
reality_condensed: Turing travelled during the evacuation.

film_condensed: Denniston interviews Turing.
reality_condensed: Denniston didn't interview him.

film_condensed: Turing appears not to have a sense of humour.
reality_condensed: Turing was known for his wit & tomfoolery.

film_condensed: Denniston is a militaristic ball-breaker.
reality_condensed: Denniston was supportive.

film_condensed: Turing is depicted as a prodigy.
reality_condensed: Turing was exceptionally clever.

film_condensed: Denniston and Turing don't get on.
reality_condensed: No evidence of any strong dislike.

film_condensed: Denniston turns Turing down.
reality_condensed: Denniston never interviews Turing.

film_condensed: Turing says he speaks no German.
reality_condensed: He learnt German at school but wasn't great at it.

film_condensed: Turing reveals he knows about Enigma.
reality_condensed: The Bletchley Park work was top secret.

film_condensed: Denniston says Enigma is unbreakable.
reality_condensed: Polish & French intelligence had already broken Enigma codes.

film_condensed: The team survey the Enigma Machine
reality_condensed: Seems likely.

film_condensed: The team include Cairncross.
reality_condensed: Cairncross never worked on Enigma.

film_condensed: Denniston explains how it works.
reality_condensed: Denniston was super experienced.

film_condensed: Polish intelligence smuggled Enigma out.
reality_condensed: Polish intelligence didn't steal an Enigma machine.

film_condensed: Denniston explains the problem - codes changed daily.
reality_condensed: More complicated than that.

film_condensed: They spar over the number of code combinations.
reality_condensed: Many billions were possible.

film_condensed: They are to work as a team of five.
reality_condensed: A small group of four worked together.

film_condensed: Menzies makes a few comments.
reality_condensed: No record of Menzies being there.

film_condensed: "20 million years worth of settings in 20 mins"
reality_condensed: It would have taken a very, very long time to check all those settings.

film_condensed: Turing comes over as lone genius.
reality_condensed: Turing was eccentric, but friendly.

film_condensed: Tensions over letter frequency analysis method.
reality_condensed: Letter frequency analysis was known to be worthless.

film_condensed: Turing designs a machine.
reality_condensed: He adapted an existing design.

film_condensed: Turing running.
reality_condensed: Turing was a runner.

film_condensed: Making a machine montage.
reality_condensed: The English developed the Enigma machine.

film_condensed: Nock discovers Turing's records are classified.
reality_condensed: They didn't dig into Turing's war records.

film_condensed: Nock uses a fake letter to request Turing's records.
reality_condensed: Not possible.

film_condensed: Denniston tells Turing his teammates have made complaints.
reality_condensed: His team didn't make complaints against him.

film_condensed: Turing argues only a machine can beat Enigma.
reality_condensed: True, but Turing not the first to realise it.

film_condensed: Denniston gives Turing a dressing down.
reality_condensed: No such confrontation.

film_condensed: Turing hands Menzies a letter for Churchhill.
reality_condensed: Turing wrote to Churchill.

film_condensed: Churchill has put Turing in charge.
reality_condensed: He didn't put Turing in charge but did reply to his letter.

film_condensed: Menzies mocks Turing for his unpopularity.
reality_condensed: Turing wasn't popular at school.

film_condensed: Flashback to Turing's school, Sherbourne.
reality_condensed: Turing attended Sherborne school.

film_condensed: Turing displays OCD symptoms.
reality_condensed: There's no evidence that Turing suffered from OCD.

film_condensed: A boy tips food over Turing's head.
reality_condensed: Bullying was common at Sherbourne.

film_condensed: Turing trapped under the floorboards.
reality_condensed: Schoolboys did trap him under the floorboards.

film_condensed: Christopher frees him.
reality_condensed: He didn't free him, but they were friends.

film_condensed: Turing proposes a crossword competition to recruit.
reality_condensed: There was such a competition.

film_condensed: Montage of people working on the crossword.
reality_condensed: There was such a competition.

film_condensed: People shelter in the undergroud during London bombings.
reality_condensed: People did use the underground as a bomb shelter.

film_condensed: Aftermath of bombings.
reality_condensed: London was repeatedly bombed.

film_condensed: Turing briefs the potential crossword recruits.
reality_condensed: There was such a competition, not organised by Turing.

film_condensed: Joan arrives, startling Turing.
reality_condensed: Joan was poached from Cambridge.

film_condensed: Joan is told to leave, she protests.
reality_condensed: Sexism was rife at the time.

film_condensed: Turing invigilates a timed task.
reality_condensed: There was a recruitment drive of this sort.

film_condensed: Joan beats Turing's time.
reality_condensed: No evidence of how her talents compared with Turing's.

film_condensed: Menzies tells recruits they'll be executed if they leak info.
reality_condensed: The sentence for treason was death.

film_condensed: Christopher explains cryptography to Turing.
reality_condensed: A different friend introduced Turing to cryptography.

film_condensed: Turing wrestles with his crush on Christopher.
reality_condensed: Turing did have a crush on Christopher Morcom at school.

film_condensed: Turing builds his computer at Bletchley.
reality_condensed: The machine wasn't build by him, or at Bletchley.

film_condensed: Joan finds Turing speaking with her parents.
reality_condensed: Turing hadn't met them at this stage.

film_condensed: Joan says her father won't let her work at Bletchley.
reality_condensed: No evidence that he father blocked her career.

film_condensed: Turing mentions that female staff live together.
reality_condensed: Likely they lived together, but Turing didn't mention it.

film_condensed: Turing repeats Christopher's motivational line.
reality_condensed: Didn't happen.

film_condensed: Nock implies Turing might be a spy.
reality_condensed: He wasn't suspected of espionage.

film_condensed: JOAN arrives at Bletchley Park.
reality_condensed: She was already at Bletchley.

film_condensed: Turing says Britain is starving to death.
reality_condensed: The Nazis were bombing supply ships but Britain wasn't starving.

film_condensed: Americans sent 100,000 tons of food per week.
reality_condensed: Cannot confirm the 100,000 tons figure.

film_condensed: The clock hits midnight, the day's work is useless.
reality_condensed: The codes were changed each day.

film_condensed: Hugh gets mad at the machine, tries to smash it.
reality_condensed: The machine was slow because the code was complex.

film_condensed: Peter blames his brother's peril on Turing.
reality_condensed: Peter didn't have a brother who worked on convoys.

film_condensed: Turing smuggles documents out to show Joan.
reality_condensed: He would never have breached security.

film_condensed: TURING calls his machine "Christopher'.
reality_condensed: The machine was called the Bombe, then Victory.

film_condensed: Joan asks about his 'Universal Machine'.
reality_condensed: One of Turing's theories concerned such a machine.

film_condensed: Denniston suspects Turing of being a spy.
reality_condensed: TURING was never suspected of being a spy.

film_condensed: Denniston says spies are loner types.
reality_condensed: Spies often don't form real relationships.

film_condensed: Denniston threatens Turing.
reality_condensed: He never threatened Turing.

film_condensed: Joan consoles Turing.
reality_condensed: Unnecessary, since he wasn't suspected of espionage.

film_condensed: They discuss codes in a bar.
reality_condensed: Unlikely they would chat about their work in public.

film_condensed: Hugh comes over, Turing gets awkward.
reality_condensed: Hugh was diplomatic and Turing was well-liked.

film_condensed: Turing comes across as socially dysfunctional.
reality_condensed: Turing was known for sociability, wit & tomfoolery.

film_condensed: Turing and Christopher pass encrypted notes.
reality_condensed: They didn't share an interest in cryptography.

film_condensed: Hugh offers an idea for wiring the machine.
reality_condensed: Welchmann actually made this suggestion.

film_condensed: They turn the machine on. It's noisy.
reality_condensed: Not housed at Bletchley but was noisy.

film_condensed: Battlefield. German tanks roll through Europe.
reality_condensed: The Germans made great advances across Europe.

film_condensed: Turing frustrated at the slowness of the machine.
reality_condensed: It was slow and took weeks to decrypt.

film_condensed: Denniston bursts in, shuts down the machine.
reality_condensed: Didn't happen.

film_condensed: Hugh defends Turing.
reality_condensed: Didn't happen.

film_condensed: Hugh bargains with Denniston.
reality_condensed: Didn't happen.

film_condensed: Hugh and Turing discuss the spy.
reality_condensed: No one knew about the spy until 1951.

film_condensed: Nock is told that Turing is gay, was robbed by man he had sex with.
reality_condensed: Turing admitted this to police.

film_condensed: NOCK asks to interrogate him.
reality_condensed: Turing reported the burglary, which brought his lifestyle to police attention.

film_condensed: Joan finds Turing frustrated by Christopher's slowness.
reality_condensed: Likely. The early machines were slow.

film_condensed: Joan announces she's leaving.
reality_condensed: Joan was happy at Bletchley.

film_condensed: TURING insists he won't let her leave.
reality_condensed: Joan was happy at Bletchley.

film_condensed: Joan lashes out at Turing.
reality_condensed: Didn't happen.

film_condensed: Turing makes an engagement ring from wire.
reality_condensed: He proposed to Joan in the traditional way.

film_condensed: They throw an engagement party.
reality_condensed: They kept their engagement secret.

film_condensed: Cairncross advises Turing not to speak of his sexuality.
reality_condensed: They never met.

film_condensed: Turing waits for Christopher, he never arrives.
reality_condensed: Christopher died.

film_condensed: Nock interviews Turing.
reality_condensed: Didn't happen.

film_condensed: The machine churns, it's struggling.
reality_condensed: The Bombe struggled against the Enigma system.

film_condensed: Joan's friend Helen is interested in Hugh.
reality_condensed: No record of this meeting.

film_condensed: Turing questions Helen on her work.
reality_condensed: Employees weren't allowed to discuss their work.

film_condensed: Turing suggests using weather reports to decode messages.
reality_condensed: It was a bit more complicated than that.

film_condensed: They apply the weather idea, and it works!
reality_condensed: Far more complicated and drawn-out than that.

film_condensed: They decode messages into a map of the North Atlantic.
reality_condensed: A bigger team did use such a map.

film_condensed: Turing stops the team from alerting a convoy to an attack.
reality_condensed: The team didn't make such decisions.

film_condensed: The team can't save Peter's brother from a convoy attack.
reality_condensed: Didn't happen, but the sinking did.

film_condensed: The blasted remains of the convoy at sea.
reality_condensed: German U-Boats torpedoed many convoys.

film_condensed: Turing and Joan go to conspire with Menzies.
reality_condensed: They didn't travel to London to conspire with Menzies.

film_condensed: Turing suggests a plan for using their intelligence.
reality_condensed: Menzies decided this for himself.

film_condensed: Turing and Joan request a cover story.
reality_condensed: This kind of thing happened.

film_condensed: MENZIES agrees.
reality_condensed: Menzies wasn't there.

film_condensed: Codename Ultra became world's largest military intelligence store.
reality_condensed: Can't confirm this.

film_condensed: It was like having a tap on Himmler's intercom.
reality_condensed: Himmler didn't have military command at that stage.

film_condensed: And for some reason they trusted TURING.
reality_condensed: They trusted him for good reason.

film_condensed: Peter knocks papers out of Turing's hands.
reality_condensed: Peter respected Turing.

film_condensed: Turing works out Cairncross is a spy.
reality_condensed: Cairncross wasn't revealed as a spy until 1951.

film_condensed: Cairncross blackmails Turing into covering for him.
reality_condensed: Turing never met Cairncross.

film_condensed: Turing keeps the secret.
reality_condensed: Never happened.

film_condensed: Turing finds Menzies at Joans, reveals Caincross is the spy.
reality_condensed: This scene never happened.

film_condensed: Menzies admits he placed Cairncross at Bletchley knowing he was a spy.
reality_condensed: Cairncross wasn't deliberately placed there.

film_condensed: Churchill too paranoid to work with the Soviets.
reality_condensed: Churchill shared some intelligence, but not methods.

film_condensed: Menzies wants to use Cairncross to leak misinformation.
reality_condensed: Cairncross wasn't an unwitting double-agent.

film_condensed: Turing insists Menzies releases Joan.
reality_condensed: Dramatic conceit. Didn't happen.

film_condensed: TURING has become a spy!
reality_condensed: There was no such setup.

film_condensed: Turing tells Joan to leave Bletchley.
reality_condensed: Didn't happen.

film_condensed: TURING tells JOAN he's homosexual.
reality_condensed: Turing told her after a few days of engagement.

film_condensed: JOAN suspected he was gay.
reality_condensed: Joan suspected Turing was gay.

film_condensed: Joan was fine with Turing's sexuality.
reality_condensed: Joan wasn't bothered by such things.

film_condensed: Turing rejects her harshly.
reality_condensed: Turing acted honourably.

film_condensed: Joan asserts herself, refuses to leave.
reality_condensed: She was deferent to men.

film_condensed: The team are forced to calculate who to save.
reality_condensed: Higher-ups made such decisions.

film_condensed: Many big battles won because of Bletchley work.
reality_condensed: Many battles were aided and won by Enigma intelligence.

film_condensed: Victory is declared for the Allies.
reality_condensed: The Allies won the war.

film_condensed: Menzies tells the team to burn everything.
reality_condensed: All materials were destroyed.

film_condensed: Turing faces Nock down.
reality_condensed: Nock didn't exist.

film_condensed: Headmaster coldly tells Turing Christopher died.
reality_condensed: All students were told with kindness, and comforted.

film_condensed: Turing sentenced for indecency.
reality_condensed: Turing sentenced on three counts of gross indeceny.

film_condensed: Joan turns up at Turing's place.
reality_condensed: They remained life-long friends.

film_condensed: She notices him twitching.
reality_condensed: Turing's circle dispute that he was depressed.

film_condensed: Judge offers prison or hormonal therapy.
reality_condensed: Turing accepted a year of hormone treatment over prison.

film_condensed: She offers to help. He refuses.
reality_condensed: JOAN wasn't there.

film_condensed: Turing says he's not alone, he has the computer.
reality_condensed: Turing never confused computers with people.

film_condensed: If Turing doesn't accept treatment they'll take the computer away.
reality_condensed: Prison would have lost Turing his position.

film_condensed: Turing breaks down.
reality_condensed: His letters show he was pragmatic.

film_condensed: Turing spots Joan's wedding ring.
reality_condensed: Joan married an army colleague.

film_condensed: Turing's hand is twitching badly.
reality_condensed: No mention of this side-effect.

film_condensed: Joan says the country has a lot to thank him for.
reality_condensed: It did, but it was a team effort.

film_condensed: Turing created a field of scientific enquiry.
reality_condensed: Turing was highly influential.

film_condensed: She repeats his catchphrase back to him.
reality_condensed: This catchphrase was made up for the film.

film_condensed: The team burning their materials at Bletchley.
reality_condensed: All materials at Bletchley were destroyed after the war.

film_condensed: Turing commited suicide after a yr of hormonal therapy.
reality_condensed: Died a year after he stopped the therapy - maybe not suicide.

film_condensed: 1885-1967 49,000 gay men convicted of gross indecency.
reality_condensed: Truly terrible.

film_condensed: Queen Elizabeth II pardoned Turing.
reality_condensed: Queen Elizabeth issued a royal pardon for Alan Turing.

film_condensed: Estimates say breaking Enigma shortened war by 2yrs+.
reality_condensed: Possibly shortened war by 2-4years.

film_condensed: Remained a secret for 50yrs.
reality_condensed: First book about Bletchley published 1974.

film_condensed: Turing's work inspired computers.
reality_condensed: His work provided a blueprint for the digital computer.
